doc.after: Between 1990 and 2001 the economy grew because of continued investment in the rehabilitation of infrastructure improved incentives for production and exports reduced inflation and gradually improved domestic security Ugandan involvement in the war in the Democratic Republic of the Congo corruption within the government and slippage in the government s determination to press reforms raise doubts about the continuation of strong growth
